Class SolarSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • SolarSystem

  • public class SolarSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Name: SolarSystem Purpose: To hold the data regarding gravitational bodies in the solar system and then use them to simulate the solar system.
    Version:
    3.2 Date: 11.12.2017
    Author:
    Harry Baker

      Default constructor of SolarSystem.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SolarSystem

        public SolarSystem​()
        Default constructor of SolarSystem. Creates 24 bodies: The Sun, the 8 planets, the moons of Earth and Mars, the Galilean Moons, Titan, Enceladus, Mimas, Pluto, Charon, Ceres and Eris. By using ArrayList, this can be added to at a later time. For clarity, the components of the GravBodys are first defined using the form: nameM = mass of body nameR = radius of body namer = position of body namev = velocity of body The GravBody is then created and then added to sol. Additionally, moons are indented below their parent body Initial data from JPL at an epoch of 00:00 22nd November 2017

      • runEular

        public void runEular​(double t,
                     double d,
                     int f,
                     java.lang.String filename)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Runs the Euler algorithm on the entire system by a time-step for a duration. It also calculates intial and final mechanical energy for every iteration and formats them as strings to be printed to output files.
        Parameters:
        t - Time-step of each iteration
        d - Duration of the simulation
        filename - Name of the output files
        f - Number of outputs to file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exception if a problem occurs writing to a file

      • runCramer

        public void runCramer​(double t,
                      double d,
                      int f,
                      java.lang.String filename)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Runs the Euler-Cramer algorithm on the entire system by a time-step for a duration. It also calculates intial and final mechanical energy for every iteration and formats them as strings to be printed to output files.

        t - Time-step of each iteration
        d - Duration of the simulation
        filename - name of the output files
        f - Number of outputs to file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws exception if a problem occurs writing to a file

      • calcTotSystemAcc

        public void calcTotSystemAcc​(java.util.ArrayList<GravBody> bodyArray)
        Calculates the total acceleration of the system due to each of the bodies gravitational fields. Each body has its acceleration due to each other body's gravity, calculated and summed up to its total acceleration.
        Parameters:
        bodyArray - ArrayList of GravBodys to have their accelerations calculated
